intro: Bornoa crassispatha, commonly known as the broad-sheath brome, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of North America. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. The plant features a robust stem with broad, flat leaves that are often hairy. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are characteristic of the Poaceae family. Bornoa crassispatha plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
